website_summaries.verdict: Some may find the higher waistband much more comfortable, especially with C-section scarring. We like the higher absorbency and the snug elastic waistband.
pros: Very absorbent, especially for postpartum bleeding and late-term incontinence
Wicks away moisture well with minimal skin irritation
Suitable for both day and night wear
cons: Bulky fit, not as discreet as others on this shortlist

customer_reviews.title: Loyal to Always
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for my elderly parent who is wheelchair bound and can't get to the bathroom anymore. We've tried other brands like Depends or TENA but these are the best. They fit really well and they are more 'discreet'. They aren't bulky either. They are also very secure and there are never any 'accidents' with these like some of the other brands we've tried. No leaking etc.. We buy these in bulk now. Definitely the best incontinence underwear we've tried.
customer_reviews.author: CottonCandy86

customer_reviews.title: Post partum must have
customer_reviews.text: Way more comfortable than the hospital mesh panties. They are so thin too, but you don't worry about bleeding through at all. And it's nice to have a little coverage in the hospital since you don't get much. Also nice not to have to fuss around with putting giant pads on and worrying about them moving around. Highly recommend for a more comfortable recovery!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: c-sections best friend
customer_reviews.text: If your going to or might have a c-section BUY THESE!!!! They are even more comfortable than the mesh underwear they give you at the hospital. I bought theses and a couple pairs of reusable ones. Trust me when i say you will have no time or energy to continually wash the reusable ones. I have my husband and mother helping me after my c-section and there isn't enough time or energy between the 3 of us. These are amazing.

customer_reviews.title: so comfortable!

customer_reviews.title: work well
customer_reviews.text: I am 55 and I was in rehab and had diarrhea from the meds they gave me. I bought Teva for home and they were bulky looking, especially in the butt and even with my yoga pants or jeans on it looked like I was wearing a diaper. I needed something on days where I was traveling in a car for hours and did not want to look like I was wearing something in public. customer_reviews.title: Go up a size for postpartum
customer_reviews.text: These are the best for postpartum use! They are high rise and very comfortable! However, I would recommend getting a small pack and going up a size. Your lady bits and lower body will be swollen after giving birth and you will not be in these for more than 2 weeks. I used one a day with a pad inside. Wish I had thought of this with my first born!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Not a great fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered small/ medium for my post delivery use but will have to return these after just trying one. Unfortunately, the size is not that great for my measurements and the fitting is very off. I wear size 6 in pants with my hips measuring 38 inches. These are made weird from the back and don’t sit or curve well on the buttocks due to which there is a gap between skin and the underwear from front to back. For this reason it feels very uncomfortable especially when you are standing or walking. It almost urge you to press it against the skin to kill the gap.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't make it to the bathroom easily. There is a scent but it's not offensive ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because after surgery, I couldn't make it to the bathroom easily. There is a scent but it's not offensive and if you leave the package open, the scent dissipates after a while. They're really comfortable and immediately absorbed wetness. Amazing! I wore them for the first time after drinking a lot of water and let's just say, they were able to handle my reenactment of Niagara Falls. I can definitely see myself using these for long trips, etc. in the future, even after recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Shoegal

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Getting Less and Less Effective
customer_reviews.text: This product is continually re-designed and apparently not so that it becomes a better product for people suffering from incontinence. Rather, the changes that are made reduce the protections and make the wearer less protected and more uncomfortable. This is no longer the "classic" cut that it purports to be. The waist is narrower and sits lower. They probably can use less plastic in this design but the brief no longer is a comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: candemonium

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable incontinence underwear ever, and I've tried a number of brands. Those other brands have scratchy elastic and ribbing around the legs; this brand has a soft elastic that also keeps the underwear in place at least as well as other brands and maybe better. The Classic Cut style fits at my actual waist and stays there without rolling or twisting (I've never liked low-rise underwear). I do wish this product also came with a moderate absorbency option, but these are okay, not overly bulky.
customer_reviews.author: NanaGee

customer_reviews.title: Too strongly perfumed.

I feel comfortable wearing these under leggings and skirts. I cut the top part off to make them "low rise". I've had accidents in them and they held in leaks well. I prefer these over Depends Silhouette which are much bulkier and bunch up around the crotch area. The only thing I can't stand about them is the scent. They smell like diapers to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jin Lan

customer_reviews.title: Great for postpartum bleeding

customer_reviews.text: Size large was listed with measurements that seemed too large. S/M seemed as if they would fit. But, they are snug. I will not buy this brand again because sizing is inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Have purchased several times
customer_reviews.text: It does the job but not very comfortable , maybe the size is not right, but other sizes are not mine. Anyway, I will continue using it.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: When ordering this product, get larger than you would from store
customer_reviews.text: My mother is 96 years old and she is incontinent. She weighs 109 lb and I ordered small to medium, which is too small for her.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Holdaway

customer_reviews.title: Postpartum must have!!
customer_reviews.text: These incontinence disposable underwear were a life saver. I had given birth and the hospital provided mesh undies with a maxi pad the size if a twin matress which I ended up using for the first day. The Always disposable underwear were super absorbent, very comfortable and they smell nice too. I definitely recommend these to anyone who's postpartum.
customer_reviews.author: Nola Charity Baby

customer_reviews.title: They are scented
customer_reviews.text: They stink so bad.. I totally missed they are "lightly" scented before ordering. I ordered these for postpartum, but i can't wear them... the smell is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect after having a baby! I liked these better than the mesh panties and pad combo you get at the hospital. Disposable and absorbent. Felt like I was wearing regular underwear, and didn’t show through my pants. Highly recommend if you’re about to have a baby!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Hovey

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I used these after I had my son and liked them more than I thought I would. They're soft and comfy. They were a little too tight for my liking in the thigh because I didn't take in to account the weight I gained there during pregnancy. I didn't worry about any leaking with them either so as a first-time mom with an unplanned C-Section it was one thing I didn't have to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Godown

customer_reviews.title: So good and sleek and functional
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how other women manage menstruation with mere pads. I use these when I am menstruating and you cannot even tell that I am wearing diapers underneath even tight clinging clothing. These do an excellent job at keeping everything happy and they absorb a lot. they are specially good at overnight use.
customer_reviews.author: Diane and Tav

customer_reviews.title: These smell
customer_reviews.text: Used after my csection instead of those awful hospital ones. These make you smell sooo bad. It doesn’t matter how often you change them, or how much or little is in there, or what it smells like, the way these trap whatever is going in it (mine was blood, not urine) these stink!! Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect post partum
customer_reviews.text: I used these after I got home from the hospital. Not going to lie, they aren’t sexy or pretty but you can pretty much kiss your worries of post partum mess getting out of these over night or through the day!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Berger

customer_reviews.title: Leaks From the Sides
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my menses. However, I wish they made this with "wings" like other period napkin products, as I have problems with leakage on the sides if I am sleeping on my side (if it matters, I have a medium flow). Not a huge fan of the fragrance either.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Great product, unfortunately the size runs small. I weight 155 and it was a little bit too tight. L would of been better.
customer_reviews.author: Fiore Tejeda

customer_reviews.title: Size Up
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the hospital during my post partum stay. They work but sizing is so off! I am 5’7 145 and these suckers are SMALL! I should have bought a large/XL instead of the small/medium even though I have no butt!
customer_reviews.author: Melyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great for postpartum
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for postpartum bleeding and are very comfortable. I bought these just before my due date so they'd be waiting for me at home. Worked really well for heavy flow and it was temping to keep using them even after I could switch to pads.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: A Post-Partum Must-Have
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my best friend as part of a post-partum care package. They seemed like a much better alternative to the mesh underwear and jumbo pads that the hospital provides. My friend preferred them so much that she had her husband get her more when she ran out.
customer_reviews.author: RCcola

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Cut was off, way too tight and bulky. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn Slavotinek

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is off.
customer_reviews.text: Waaaaay too small on the hips. Supposed to go up to 200 lbs. after having a baby I weighed 170 and could barely squeeze over my hips.
customer_reviews.author: J. Long

customer_reviews.title: Must have postpartum
customer_reviews.text: A must have for postpartum women! I texted all my pregnant friends to tell them. I will definitely get these again with future pregnancies. Way more comfy than mesh panties and a huge pad that you’d get at the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Stephani Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for postpartum
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Used it after delivery. Good product. Can’t imagine postpartum days without this one. Very comfortable and absorbing. Must buy postpartum product
customer_reviews.author: Saurav

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I wish i had know about this on my 1st pregnancy. I use them instead of the panty mesh, 100x more comfortable and absorbent without having to use huge pads.
customer_reviews.author: Valeria

customer_reviews.title: Works well, sensitive skin beware
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable and absorbent. Bought these for after giving birth. 3 stars because I would have really liked them if they didn’t cause me to break out in a bad rash!
customer_reviews.author: A.A.

customer_reviews.title: Postpartum
customer_reviews.text: Used these for postpartum. So much better than the bulky padding I was using. These made getting around much easier, and I never leaked through a pair.
customer_reviews.author: carag

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again if needed
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely discreet. They are stretchy and fit nicely. There were days I wanted a pad over this, but these seem more breathable/airy and not has sweaty as pads.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Not crazy about these
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable, too long and only stick to me...won't buy again. Their others are better.
customer_reviews.author: nwh

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not very absorbent.
customer_reviews.text: These are very discreet and comfortable but if you are walking the liquid will be moved and it causes a leak.
customer_reviews.author: Marj

customer_reviews.title: strong plastic smell
customer_reviews.text: they come with very strong plastic smell and fitting is poor, do not recommend, stay away
customer_reviews.author: Trani
